abstract: Efforts by Democratic vice presidential nominee Sen Tim Kaine, during his tenure as mayor of Richmond, Va, to heal city's historic racial divisions drew mixed reactions; Kaine's immersion in black community's institutions and concerns was sometimes undermined by controversial policies that came out of his efforts to remain a centrist aiming for compromise rather than fighting for radical change.
lead_paragraph: He found himself navigating the charged history and sensitivities of the same African-American community he had embraced in his private life.
snippet: He found himself navigating the charged history and sensitivities of the same African-American community he had embraced in his private life....

headline.main: Tim Kaine Recalled for Commitment to Richmond’s African-Americans
headline.print_headline: With Slips and Strides as Mayor, Kaine Tried to Heal Racial Divide
